intro: Microseris laciniata, commonly known as the fringed biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has basal leaves that are deeply lobed or fringed, giving it its common name. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. Microseris laciniata is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes.
